Testimony in today's January 6th hearing proves that Donald Trump threatened irreparable harm to our democracy, and undermined the sanctity of our elections.

This hearing proves the importance of the January 6th Committee's work - if elected I will ensure this work continues. https://t.co/u2oUALf72G

Thank you @potus for signing this bill into law. America has gone too long without common-sense gun reforms, and we have paid the price for it. When I am elected to Congress, I vow to work across the aisle to pass common-sense laws, like this one, that will keep Americans safe. https://t.co/5o5FuUhd3r

I hope that my colleagues in the Legislature join me in passing this bill. 
(2/2)

At time when @scotus is making life for millions of Americans more dangerous, I want to make my community safer. Prohibiting concealed carry on county property and transit, as well as at Nassau Community College will keep Nassau County safe. 
(1/2) https://t.co/LWErPTZ0H3

In Congress, I‚Äôll vote to #CodifyRoeNow.
(3/3)

In New York, we are fortunate that abortions are safe and legal, but this decision by the Supreme Court has endangered the lives of tens of millions of women across our country. We can‚Äôt sit by as this fundamental rights is taken away - now is the time for action.
(2/3)

The Supreme Court‚Äôs decision to overturn Roe v. Wade comes at the culmination of a decades-long assault on reproductive rights and as anti-choice extremists passed draconian laws at the state level and politicized the courts at the federal level.
(1/3)

Our veterans rely on the indispensable healthcare services provided by the Northport VA and we must not allow for any such care to be taken away from those willing to make the ultimate sacrifice for our nation.

The move by the VA to close its Northport facility will prove devastating to the veteran population of Long Island. 
https://t.co/iJhkXsciYI

Too often, government is reactive, rather than proactive. This road has seen two serious car accidents in the last week alone, and we must take steps now, to prevent further tragedies as a result of current issues going unaddressed.

Yesterday, I held a press conference to call on the Nassau County Department of Public works to conduct a traffic study of Glen Cove Road, to determine appropriate traffic calming measures, that will tackle the increase in car accidents on Glen Cove Road. https://t.co/6mROa3CwBl
